</td><td>

Get node privacy level by iterating over its ancestors. When the direct parent privacy level is know, it is best to use something like:

derivePrivacyLevelGivenParent(getNodeSelfPrivacyLevel(node), parentNodePrivacyLevel)

<tr><td>

[reducePrivacyLevel(childPrivacyLevel, parentNodePrivacyLevel)](./browser-rum-core.reduceprivacylevel.md)


</td><td>

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[sanitizeDataUrl(url)](./browser-rum-core.sanitizedataurl.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[shouldIgnoreElement(element)](./browser-rum-core.shouldignoreelement.md)


</td><td>

TODO: Preserve CSS element order, and record the presence of the tag, just don't render We don't need this logic on the recorder side. For security related meta's, customer can mask themmanually given they are easy to identify in the HEAD tag.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[shouldMaskNode(node, privacyLevel)](./browser-rum-core.shouldmasknode.md)


</td><td>

Helper aiming to unify `mask` and `mask-user-input` privacy levels:

In the `mask` case, it is trivial: we should mask the element.

In the `mask-user-input` case, we should mask the element only if it is a "form" element or the direct parent is a form element for text nodes).

Other `shouldMaskNode` cases are edge cases that should not matter too much (ex: should we mask a node if it is ignored or hidden? it doesn't matter since it won't be serialized).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[startRum(configuration, recorderApi, profilerApi, initialViewOptions, createEncoder, trackingConsentState, customVitalsState)](./browser-rum-core.startrum.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[startViewHistory(lifeCycle)](./browser-rum-core.startviewhistory.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[supportPerformanceTimingEvent(entryType)](./browser-rum-core.supportperformancetimingevent.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>

</td><td>

Text censoring non-destructively maintains whitespace characters in order to preserve text shape during replay.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[DEFAULT\_PROGRAMMATIC\_ACTION\_NAME\_ATTRIBUTE](./browser-rum-core.default_programmatic_action_name_attribute.md)


</td><td>

Get the action name from the attribute 'data-dd-action-name' on the element or any of its parent. It can also be retrieved from a user defined attribute.


</td></tr>

<tr><td>

[STABLE\_ATTRIBUTES](./browser-rum-core.stable_attributes.md)


</td><td>

Stable attributes are attributes that are commonly used to identify parts of a UI (ex: component). Those attribute values should not be generated randomly (hardcoded most of the time) and stay the same across deploys. They are not necessarily unique across the document.


</td></tr>
